intro: Boehmeria radiata, commonly known as Chinese nettle or wild flax, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairless leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Its fibers are used in traditional textiles and papermaking, highlighting its economic and cultural significance. The plant also has medicinal uses in traditional Chinese medicine.
